com.thomsonreuters.platformservices.ema.utils.chain

Interface FlatChain

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Chain

    public interface FlatChain
extends Chain
    The interface of a Chain implementation you can use to open flat chains (meaning non recursive chains). FlatChains must be built using a FlatChain.Builder. As an example, the code snippet below creates and opens a FlatChain for the Dow Jones chain published on the ELEKTRON_DD service: 

        OmmConsumer ommConsumer = ...;
      .
      .
      .
    FlatChain theChain = new FlatChain.Builder()
                  .withOmmConsumer(ommConsumer)
                  .withChainName("0#.DJI")
                  .withServiceName("ELEKTRON_DD")
                  .build();
 
    theChain.open();

    There are more parameters you can use with FlatChain objects. They must be set at built time via a FlatChain.Builder. Please refer to this class for the exhaustive list.
    Note that this implementation of FlatChains is synchronized. It can be used indifferently with the API_DISPATCH and USER_DISPATCH OmmConsumer operation models.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  FlatChain.Builder
      Used to build FlatChain objects.
      static interface  FlatChain.ChainCompleteFunction
      Represents an operation that is called when a chain is complete.
      static interface  FlatChain.ChainErrorFunction
      Represents an operation that is called when a chain is in error.
      static interface  FlatChain.ElementAddedFunction
      Represents an operation that is called when an element is added to a FlatChain.
      static interface  FlatChain.ElementChangedFunction
      Represents an operation that is called when an chain element changes.
      static interface  FlatChain.ElementRemovedFunction
      Represents an operation that is called when an element is removed from a chain.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> getElements()
      Returns the elements of this chain.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.thomsonreuters.platformservices.ema.utils.chain.Chain

        close, getName, getServiceName, isAChain, isComplete, open

    • Method Detail

      • getElements

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String> getElements()
        Returns the elements of this chain. FlatChain elements are returned in a Map with the elements positions as keys and the elements names as values. The first position starts at 0. The map is sorted according to the natural ordering of the positions. If the chain is not complete this method may return a partial list of elements.
        Returns:
        a Map that contains the elements names (values) and their respective positions (keys).
        See Also:
        Chain.isComplete(), FlatChain.Builder.onChainComplete(FlatChain.ChainCompleteFunction)
